meanings.definition: A person who supports or promotes something.
meanings.sent1: The favourer of the team cheered loudly at the game.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a favourer of local businesses in the community.
meanings.sent3: The favourer of chocolate ice cream always brings extra for everyone.
meanings.sent4: As a favourer of education, he always attends school events.
meanings.sent5: The favourer of recycling diligently separates waste for a cleaner environment.

meanings.definition: To show approval or preference for something.
meanings.sent1: I favourer the blue dress over the red one for the party.
meanings.sent2: She tends to favourer action movies over romantic comedies.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to favourer the new toy over the old one.
meanings.sent4: His taste buds favourer spicy food more than sweet treats.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will favourer students who complete their assignments on time.

meanings.definition: To treat someone with kindness or generosity.
meanings.sent1: She always favourer her guests with warm hospitality.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will favourer patients with extra care and attention.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to favourer the audience with an extra trick.
meanings.sent4: The chef will favourer the regular customers with complimentary desserts.
meanings.sent5: The landlord will favourer tenants who maintain the property well.
